conclusion: Analyze the geometry of the semi-cylindrical transparent object and the behavior of light.
Identify the given information: semi-cylinder radius R, light enters along axis OA, light moves to point C at distance sqrt(3)/3 R from O.
Light ray enters the semi-cylinder from the left.
Path of light ray will be refracted at the interface between the semi-cylinder and the medium.
Angle of incidence equals angle of refraction, therefore n1 = sin(theta2)/sin(theta1).
Using law of refraction, n1/n2 = sin(theta2)/sin(theta1) = sqrt(3)/3.
Solve for n2, the refractive index of the semi-cylinder: n2 = sqrt(3).
Refractive index of the transparent object is n2 = sqrt(3).
Since light ray moves from left to right, refractive index of semi-cylinder is same as transparent object.
Thus, refractive index of the transparent object is sqrt(3).
